item.title: In conversation with Soojin Kang
item.description: “My work speaks with emotion. The surfaces I weave, the positive and negative space that becomes the forms that I create…” - Soojin Kang Image: Soojin Kang. © Markus Schroder Soojin Kang is a Korean artist now based in Germany, whose practice is based on the exploration of textiles as a sculptural medium. Using the ritualistic actions of weaving, knotting, winding and unwinding, she transubstantiates raw materials into structures that retain unmistakeable traces of their biotic origins through rough surfaces and natural dyes.
